intro.description: This cheat sheet helps you to open an image, and shows you how to use the circle/ellipse fitting tool with the file. If you have just completed the previous cheat sheet, please close all your data file parts.

item.title: Data Browsing Perspective
item.description: Please choose the data browsing perspective if you do not already have it selected (nothing will happen if you do not).

item.title: Open File
item.description: Click to open an example file from the 'data' project containing a test image.

item.title: Select 'Circle/Ellipse Fitting' tool
item.description: Select the 'Circle/Ellipse Fitting' tool from the toolbar above the plot, tools labelled 'Image tools used to profile and inspect images'. These tools may be obscured on Linux if the window containing the plot is too small.

item.title: Circle-only fitting
item.description: A button near the top left of the tool view can be toggled on to restrict the shape fitted to a circle instead of an ellipse. It affects the current fit and any future fits.

item.title: Fit a circle or an ellipse
item.description:
Select an elliptical or circular feature in the image to fit. Click on at least 3 (or 5 for an ellipse) points of the selected feature spreading points over broad curves and concentrating points on tighter sections. A dashed segmented line is shown that joins the selected points together. After the third point is clicked, the fitted circle is shown and more points can be added. To finish adding points, click on the last point again without moving the mouse. If the circle-only button is off, then the fitted shape becomes an ellipse on the fifth point added, otherwise it remains a circle.
The fitted ellipse is displayed with handle boxes on the clicked points and a centre handle box shown on its major axis.

item.title: Fitted ellipse parameters
item.description: Look at the 'Circle/Ellipse Fitting' tool view on the right hand side of the image. Here you will see a table of geometric parameters of the fitted ellipses. The columns include major and minor semi-axes lengths (equivalent to radius of a circle), angle of the major axis and centre coordinates. For a circular fit, the semi-axes are equal in length and the angle is zero.

item.title: Adjusting a fitted ellipse
item.description: Any of the handles can be clicked and dragged to adjust its position and influence the fitting of the ellipse. The centre handle solely translates the whole ellipse and its points.
item.onCompletion: Congratulations, you can now fit circles and ellipses to features in images. Try with your own images.
